comments.value:
As per our discussion on Monday, it is asking for trouble for us to name the checkbox on the Specialist group form as 'Use the accessible form' as everyone will choose it.

Is it possible please to rename the ‘Use the accessible form’ to ‘I am a screen reader user’?

Thanks!

Thank that makes perfect sense, changing now..

"Use the accessible" sounds way to inviting ;-) make the alternative sound painful (cough...) 

I thick wording can really influence whether people tick a box or not, it's like airline meals, if you ask someone if they have 'Dietary preference' people are likely to say 'Oh, yes, I hate reheated airline meals, if I tick this box I might get something fresher, less sloppy earlier than everyone else?'. If your asked 'Do you have a dietary requirement ' then people are less likely to tick it unless they 'have a real requirement'. (well airline meal are probably a bad example as everyone know they are all pretty grim and that you never get upgraded if you order a special meal !!)
Thanks, Jamie – a good spot from you on Monday!

subject: Volunteering: Specialist group form - tweak to field name
description:

Thanks!

What would you like to have as a text underneath the video? 

Kitsite: need to mod theming.js / externalLinks() to get the correct copy in there, estimate 0.1;

Thats done but a couple of points:

  - i would like the size of the videos to pre-set them
  - are we going to have text underneath or keep it blank

*- thats done -* 
Kitsite: need to mod theming.js / externalLinks() to get the correct copy in there, estimate 0.1;

All volunteering pages and the lightbox are to be republished

comments.value:
Have noticed that the left hand nav seems to 'bounce' when you click around lower-level sections e.g. click from 'Are you eligible' to 'Games Maker values'. This doesn't seem to happen on other sections of the website. Can you advise what might be causing this and if there is a fix?

Many thanks

Sideways or up and down?

The sideways may be due to the scroll bar appearing / not appearing? We can try and force a scroll bar on all pages but it's not always 100% successful. This might be a total red herring though.

Hi Jamie

It’s bouncing up and down rather than sideways.

This is in IE8 – haven’t tested it yet in FF.
Bouncing, like a Mexican Lowrider http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xmf5gLPMtTc apparently..
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".
marking as high priority

Morag, i've been looking to find the bounciness but i couldn't replicate the problem. Could it be that you are looking at the page in preview and the slow-loading of the website makes it appear as a bounciness of the navigation?
I'm marking this as solved but if this is still an issue, please reopen this one!

Sorry, Lars – this is still an issue. It seems to occur in IE8. I am not viewing in preview – I am viewing on live.

Did you see the video which I sent to Jamie?
Morag, Sorry i didn't receive that one, should i ask him to forward it to me or do you still have a copy for me?

I've started on this but its a site-wide change in the original cogapp code and 
i don't want to put it live on friday 6pm so its going to be live on monday! 

This should stop the nav bouncing all over though! :D
This should finally be sorted now! But its publishing takes some time because of the newly introduced cache headers

Hi Lars

Not seeing any improvement yet – do I need to republish the site?

Morag

I've published it site-wide but unfortunately the newly introduced cache stops it from appearing for quite a while.
I've now reverted it and wait for the javascript and css changes to go though the cache, then i willl put the fix back
and then we're sorted! ( is the plan )

comments.value:
On a slightly different question: Apache logging.

How is logging configured on the web servers at the moment?

It's just straight out of the box Apache combined log files, we haven't touched anything here.

/var/log/httpd/access_log
/var/log/httpd/error_log

Do you have any capability on the box to allow us to quickly report on the number of hits each servers is taking.

I have enabled /server-status for you on both machines, not sure if this is useful?
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/server-status
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/server-info

btw. the volunteering servers are just using the default Apache settings for MaxClients/ServerLimit if your doing any form of load testing this probably needs increasing as it's current set to allow a maximum of 256 processes. 

I know the site is configured to use Google analytics but it doesn't really give us the required timeliness for the volunteering go live.
The locog/BT management wanted stats every 15 minutes on the mascot launch and the Google analytics stuff didn't appear to come through until about 3 hours after the event.

Depends on how accurate / digested they need the data, 

You could be really quick / dirty and just scan the access log file on one of the servers to see how many requests there had been for .php pages on a given day and then multiple that figure by a factor of 6 (*) to get a rough guesstimate of the traffic across all servers.

cat /var/log/httpd/access_log | grep 07\/Jul\/2010 | grep .php | wc -l

(this above basically says find all request for .php pages on a given date and then count how many lines we have)

* I assume the traffic is equally distributed between all the servers by the load balancer ?

Can you help in this area?

We could create a page to display the output of the above via the web site if that would suffice ?

The issue is really the more granular the detail required, the longer the processing will take, but I assume they just want a rule of thumb to gauge interest ie. the site is X times more busy than yesterday?

There are some hosted stats packages that might give better turnaround in terms of processing that Google Analytics, for example Chartbeat

http://chartbeat.com/ 

Would be easy enough to add this to the Volunteering pages as I assume we will republish them all before launch.

Let me know, if you want us to work on any of the above..

Jamie

I've got someone from ipsoft looking in to it but I'd be keen to hear your view.

Col.
Marking as solved. See separate correspondence between Jamie and Jagdeep.

btw. the volunteering servers are just using the default Apache settings for MaxClients/ServerLimit if your doing any form of load testing this probably needs increasing as it's current set to allow a maximum of 256 processes. 

I know the site is configured to use Google analytics but it doesn't really give us the required timeliness for the volunteering go live.
The locog/BT management wanted stats every 15 minutes on the mascot launch and the Google analytics stuff didn't appear to come through until about 3 hours after the event.

Depends on how accurate / digested they need the data, 

You could be really quick / dirty and just scan the access log file on one of the servers to see how many requests there had been for .php pages on a given day and then multiple that figure by a factor of 6 (*) to get a rough guesstimate of the traffic across all servers.

(this above basically says find all request for .php pages on a given date and then count how many lines we have)

* I assume the traffic is equally distributed between all the servers by the load balancer ?

Can you help in this area?

We could create a page to display the output of the above via the web site if that would suffice ?

The issue is really the more granular the detail required, the longer the processing will take, but I assume they just want a rule of thumb to gauge interest ie. the site is X times more busy than yesterday?

There are some hosted stats packages that might give better turnaround in terms of processing that Google Analytics, for example Chartbeat

http://chartbeat.com/ 

Would be easy enough to add this to the Volunteering pages as I assume we will republish them all before launch.

comments.value:
Hi Jamie

There is an urgent last minute request regarding the ‘accessible form’ for volunteering. Can you advise if the below is possible at this stage?

 Add two new fields: ‘Primary contact type’ (with drop down values Home, Mobile, Work) and ‘Primary contact number’

Could these be added under a heading ‘Contact numbers’?

I know this is short notice – please let me know if you think this is remotely doable ready for the end of next week.

Thanks!

Morag
Just to follow up on my conversation with Jamie, we have now been instructed to do this work. So if you can proceed on the basis above, that would be fab, thanks.

Hi Morag,

These fields have now been added.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/access-games-maker/index.php

Although we have checked basic form submission and the 'required fields' stuff. Because we have made 'technical' changes since your last round of testing, it's probably worth doing another (maybe just internal) round of testing before this goes live, leaving time so we can fix any issues that (hopefully won't) come up.

Looks good – thanks so much!

Will make sure we do a thorough round of testing.

I know this is short notice – please let me know if you think this is remotely doable ready for the end of next week.

comments.value:
I forgot to mention: the banner on the Volunteering website templates (Have you got what it takes, plus the Games Maker logo) is going to be resupplied as a Flash file later this week.

Can you advise how long you would need to integrate this?
If it's the same size then /hopefully/ fairly quickly, ie. we should just be able to swap images/links

Is the banner currently a Flash banner though?

I have just heard from McCann that they won't be able to get the banner to us until Friday pm. I realise this is going to be very late in the day to integrate ready for Monday - it's not super critical if it can't happen for Monday though.

Oh sorry Morag, 

Misunderstood, I thought it was a straight 1 for 1 swap.

I think we'll need to wait and see, if it's arriving Friday pm I'd say the likelihood of having it ready for Monday is low, esp. as Friday pm could be 5pm onwards ;-)

Jamie

comments.value:
Hello

Just wanted to catch up with you re: launching the alternative formats from the right hand column.

There are two elements (I would like you to delete the 'Download the MP3 link).

1. Easy read - you are currently linking to a larger font version of the page. In fact, this needs to link to a pdf document which will be a summary of the entire volunteering programme. There will only be one Easy Read document - i.e. the same link from every page.

2. British Sign Language - we are going to record a separate video for each page, summarising the text content in BSL (BSL users often aren't good at reading the written word). A company called ReMark will create a Flash file for each video (we aren't in a position to do this until you have signed off the copy). What is the best way to present this Flash file - do I need to commission a special player so that people can play and rewind the video? How do we link up these files to the BSL link in the right-hand pod? Also, this will need to be different on each page - so I assume this needs to be changed from being an include to an editable area.

Can you advise?

Hi Morag,

Should be able to sort both of these out tomorrow without any issue.

Jamie

1. Easy read 

- (KS) Make easy read / BSL box page level editable (rather than include)
- (Morag) Upload PDF's and assign links

2. British Sign Language 

- (Morag) to commission BB to create videos which will be supplied as a SWF file (as per other videos on the site)
- (KS) Need a create new MetaData field to hold this url
- (KS) Need a Implement Vidoe player in lightbox with video player / close button.
- (KS) BSL image should pop open above light box
- Morag to assign video links once above is tested
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".
marking as high priority

1.Jamie:
  - (KS) Make easy read / BSL box page level editable (rather than include)
  - (Morag) Upload PDF's and assign links 

Do you really want me to move this out to the templates to make it editiable as
there's only one link and one pdf for all pages in the cms. So we could just 
get the copy and link right once and its done. Or do you think there's alot
of changes to the copy?

2. I've added a meta-field to the page to hold the sign language video url. 
   - so now we need to implement the lightbox

comments.value:
[Liz I am opening this as a separate ticket, previously mentioned in http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/797]

We'll also need a 'Discovering Places' tick box next to the 'Inspire programme' one.

This is already on the OW event submission form. It's the tick box of 'expressing interest'. When an event goes live, if that box is ticked it will BE a discovering places event. We will manually un-tick it if we don't want it to come up as one.

- create new CSS / layout new 'Discovering places' check box next to 'Inspire programme' one.
- code back end to show only events where the ''expressing interest'' box is checked.
- code check box to auto tick when form is reloaded and box previously checked.
- test and deploy
Set to high. Still pending, awaiting authorization.
I believe this is the issue we were just talking about. Status changed from pending to open.

This is going live now.

Liz, you mentioned you might also want to change the behaviour of the advanced link - can you refresh my memory about the story number / story? I kept it as it is for the moment.
My thought there was just to have the default be expanded ... just don’t think it’s hugely intuitive to have to expand it?

P.S. Looks awesome. And works a treat. Teenly alignment issue?

[cid:image001.png@01CB1208.99CF0230]

Liz,
It definitely makes sense to open the advanced area when the user previously picked one of the checkboxes. Having it always open would make it a bit more cluttered.

Looking at the alignment issue as well.
Sorted out these two, marking as pending.
Am confused as to what’s changed?

Two minor things:

- checkboxes are a bit nicer aligned in the advanced area
- when you do a search with one of the advanced settings, your advanced area will open automatically in the result page.
Ah! The second thing is a bit more subtle than i anticipated, but it’s definitely a step in right direction!
Marking as solved.

Any possible ideas why these events (and strangely these events only) seem to be displaying the wrong date on the map?  They're right on the details page...  I can call up Stamen, but wasn't sure if you had any brilliant insights...

Looks to me as if Jamie's diagnosis was spot-on. It appears that the creation date is appearing on the map, rather than the startDate.
My knowledge of how the Stamen feed works is pretty limited.
I think we send them a list of pages to come and retrieve.
They presumably need to amend their retrieval code such that it extracts "startDate" from Events, rather than creation date?
This bug is not strictly related to the original story. I'm reassigning to Kieran and putting to pending so that Liz can get back when there's any developments.
I don’t have any updates... it feels a bit odd since it’s only a few events. But it’s really aggravating them. Any idea??

I have emailed Stamen detailing what I think the problem is.
Will keep ticket open as I'm hoping for a quick response.
My time is now 0.1 on this ticket. In addition to the current "0.3", which I think was janos' time on the original ticket.
As a matter of interest, those particular events have since disappeared from the Stamen map.

Time thus far:
Original ticket: 0.3, Janos
start/endDate problems: 0.3, Kieran
start/endDate problems: 0.8, Jamie (this is a guess by Kieran)

Original issue: 0.3 days (Janos)
Start/endDate problem: 0.8 days (Jamie 0.5 days + Kieran 0.3 days)

Marking as solved.

On 9 Jul 2010, at 12:10, Liz Goulding wrote:

> Jamie,
> 
> I am manually going through and adding end-dates to the one day events.  It seems to be working... is it doing something bad?
> 
> Liz
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com] 
> Sent: 09 July 2010 12:03
> To: tom@stamen.com
> Cc: Kieran Topping; mike@stamen.com; Liz Goulding; shawn@stamen.com; deborah@stamen.com
> Subject: Re: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
> 
> Thanks Tom,
> 
> It would be preferable for us not to force the end date as I think we may have code on the site that uses the fact that there is no end date to indicate a 1 day event and I can't actually add in a conditional to the endpoint you use (to retrieve the events) as it's our generic one that we keep free of any client specific code.
> 
> But let us know how it's looking in terms of you fixing the swf. If it looks like your going to be pressed to get a fix in in time we could run though all events and just update those without an end date (and keep our fingers crossed it doesn't cause any issue elsewhere). If we did this you would need to to re-retive all the events though.
> 
> Jamie
> 
> On 8 Jul 2010, at 22:19, Tom Carden wrote:
> 
>> Hi Jamie,
>> 
>> I just followed up with Kieran and Liz with a longer diagnosis for the incorrect dates. In summary we're not using the event start date in the map/timeline unless there's a corresponding end date. It all comes through in the API correctly it's just that the swf is falling back to creation date in the absence of a full range.
>> 
>> A quick fix on your end would be to require an end date for all events before sending them over to our API. But I'm talking to Shawn about implementing a fix to the swf as well or instead. We'll keep you posted.
>> 
>> Cheers,
>> 
>> Tom.
>> 
>> 
>> Kieran Topping wrote:
>>> Hi Tom, Mike,
>>> I'm just forwarding this original email to you two, in case you haven't seen it. This appears to still be an issue, independent of the problem with the Edinburgh event.
>>> I am out of the office on Friday, but Jamie (jamie@kitsite.com  can be contacted in my absence.
>>> Kind regards,
>>> Kieran
>>> 
>>> ---------- Forwarded message ----------
>>> From: *Kieran Topping* <kieran@kitsite.com 
>>> Date: Fri, Jul 2, 2010 at 1:46 PM
>>> Subject: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
>>> To: shawn@stamen.com 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> Hello Shawn,
>>> 
>>> I'm investigating a problem whereby incorrect dates are appearing in the London2012 map.
>>> 
>>> The easiest way for me to describe the problem is with a screenshot. Please see the attached "MapLondon2012.png". This was generated by performing a search for "Open Weekend 2010" and then clicking on the "5" link to the West of Glasgow.
>>> 
>>> The problem is that the map is displaying the wrong date for the Events. It appears to me that you are using the Event's "creation-date" rather than the "startDate".
>>> 
>>> When you retrieve the Event object via the api, you get some xml looking like this (nb I've removed all but the relevant elements):  
>>> <page id="2912669" name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike Safari" display-name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike Safari" section="Events" path="events/discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" filename="discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" template="Event" is-include="false" encoding="utf-8" lang="en" owner="community-frontend" state="Published" flags="100011101000000" creation-date="201006140849" modification-date="201006291205" publication-date="201006291205" first-publication-date="201006181739" language="en">
>>>   ...
>>>   <group iid="300" type="group">
>>>       <startDate iid="131" type="date">20100725</startDate>
>>>   </group>
>>>   ...
>>> </page>
>>> 
>>> It appears to me that you're displaying the creation-date ("201006140849", i.e. "14 June 2010") instead of the startDate ("20100725", i.e. "27 July 2010").
>>> 
>>> Can you confirm whether this is the case please? and also let me know if you'd be able to correct it?
>>> 
>>> Many thanks in advance,
>>> 
>>> Kieran
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>> 
>>

>> www.stamen.com

> Thanks Tom,
> 
> It would be preferable for us not to force the end date as I think we may have code on the site that uses the fact that there is no end date to indicate a 1 day event and I can't actually add in a conditional to the endpoint you use (to retrieve the events) as it's our generic one that we keep free of any client specific code.
> 
> But let us know how it's looking in terms of you fixing the swf. If it looks like your going to be pressed to get a fix in in time we could run though all events and just update those without an end date (and keep our fingers crossed it doesn't cause any issue elsewhere). If we did this you would need to to re-retive all the events though.
> 
> Jamie
> 
> On 8 Jul 2010, at 22:19, Tom Carden wrote:
> 
>> Hi Jamie,
>> 
>> I just followed up with Kieran and Liz with a longer diagnosis for the incorrect dates. In summary we're not using the event start date in the map/timeline unless there's a corresponding end date. It all comes through in the API correctly it's just that the swf is falling back to creation date in the absence of a full range.
>> 
>> A quick fix on your end would be to require an end date for all events before sending them over to our API. But I'm talking to Shawn about implementing a fix to the swf as well or instead. We'll keep you posted.
>> 
>> Cheers,
>> 
>> Tom.
>> 
>> 
>> Kieran Topping wrote:
>>> Hi Tom, Mike,
>>> I'm just forwarding this original email to you two, in case you haven't seen it. This appears to still be an issue, independent of the problem with the Edinburgh event.
>>> I am out of the office on Friday, but Jamie (jamie@kitsite.com  can be contacted in my absence.
>>> Kind regards,
>>> Kieran
>>> 
>>> ---------- Forwarded message ----------
>>> From: *Kieran Topping* <kieran@kitsite.com 
>>> Date: Fri, Jul 2, 2010 at 1:46 PM
>>> Subject: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
>>> To: shawn@stamen.com 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> Hello Shawn,
>>> 
>>> I'm investigating a problem whereby incorrect dates are appearing in the London2012 map.
>>> 
>>> The easiest way for me to describe the problem is with a screenshot. Please see the attached "MapLondon2012.png". This was generated by performing a search for "Open Weekend 2010" and then clicking on the "5" link to the West of Glasgow.
>>> 
>>> The problem is that the map is displaying the wrong date for the Events. It appears to me that you are using the Event's "creation-date" rather than the "startDate".
>>> 
>>> When you retrieve the Event object via the api, you get some xml looking like this (nb I've removed all but the relevant elements):  
>>> <page id="2912669" name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike Safari" display-name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike Safari" section="Events" path="events/discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" filename="discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" template="Event" is-include="false" encoding="utf-8" lang="en" owner="community-frontend" state="Published" flags="100011101000000" creation-date="201006140849" modification-date="201006291205" publication-date="201006291205" first-publication-date="201006181739" language="en">
>>>   ...
>>>   <group iid="300" type="group">
>>>       <startDate iid="131" type="date">20100725</startDate>
>>>   </group>
>>>   ...
>>> </page>
>>> 
>>> It appears to me that you're displaying the creation-date ("201006140849", i.e. "14 June 2010") instead of the startDate ("20100725", i.e. "27 July 2010").
>>> 
>>> Can you confirm whether this is the case please? and also let me know if you'd be able to correct it?
>>> 
>>> Many thanks in advance,
>>> 
>>> Kieran
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>> 
>> 
>> -- 
>> tom@stamen.com
>> www.stamen.com
>>

comments.value:
On the event submission form, it says to leave the end date blank if it's happening only one day.  That is the cause of all our problems!  Could you please remove that, and have it say 'enter the same date as the end date if your event is only one day'?

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012
This looks like high priority to me.

Hi Liz,

I'd so much rather we fixed this at Stamens end which sounds like they have done now?

Adding both a start and end date is a bit of hack, which I only agreed to as I was concerned Stamen may not be able to fix the issue at their end. To be honest I probably should have put mu foot down as it's exactly little hacks like this that come back to haunt us a couple of months down the line.

Jamie
Well, why don’t we take one of the end dates out, and see what happens to the event? I want to make sure it actually works!

The problem isn't taking out the end date, it was us /adding in/ both a start and end date for one day events.

The most likely mess up would have been 'one day' events displaying as Start date: 16/7/2010 End date: 16/7/2010 rather than just Date: 16/7/2010 but it seems we are fin on the event page (as we coded to deal with this situation).

My point was really that we coded everything to do with events on the site based on the understanding that we just needed a start event for a one day event, not both a start and end date. 

Stamen had a bug at their end which meant that if they didn't have an end date (for any event) they displayed the creation date of the page.

The correct solution was for Stamen to fix their bug, not for us to start 'fixing up' our events in a way we never intended them to be used.

Having a quick look round the site it seems we are fine, but this sort of hack is exactly the thing that leads to unexpected behavior and a wasted morning trying to figure out why something is now working differently to the expected.

(btw. re-reading, I realise the tone on thsi response may come across wrong, so just to clarify I'm not grumpy/moaning !!!! More being reflective in terms of "We shouldn't do this in future, I should have said no Stamen need to fix the root cause, this is the sort of thing that ends up opening a can of worms").

My understanding is that Stamen have now fixed the map so can go back to just using a single date field.

:-)
Right. My point was why don’t we try using a single date field, and make sure that it does work.

Ah!!!! You mean see if work son the map now!

Gothca :)
